revised_title: Optical Properties and Phenomena of Mother-of-Pearl and Other Substances
tldr: This article explores the unique optical properties of mother-of-pearl and how its properties can be transferred to other substances. The author, David Brewster, examines the surface structure of mother-of-pearl and its role in producing colorful images and light polarization. He also discusses the limitations of this phenomenon and the potential for future discoveries in physical optics.
